Title:What to do if you see error code 011 (Cannot connect to Roku)

Error code: 011
Description: Indicates the software update has failed because your Roku device is unable to connect to the Roku Software Update Server.

Solution:
1. Wait a few minutes and select “Try again”
2. Go to support.roku.com and check to see if there are any alerts indicating that the service is currently experiencing problems.
3. If the Roku device detects that it is no longer connected to the internet, you will see a message leading you through the process of re-connecting to your home network. If you are having trouble connecting to your home network, visit: What to do if you cannot connect to your wireless network.

This document provides a solution to error code 011 (Cannot connect to Roku). It suggests waiting a few minutes and selecting “Try again”, checking support.roku.com for any alerts, and re-connecting to the home network if the Roku device is no longer connected to the internet. This document can answer questions such as what to do if you see error code 011, what to do if the software update has failed, and what to do if you cannot connect to your wireless network.

Title:What to do if your Roku streaming device is unable to update software

Error codes: 001, 002, 003, 004, 005.

Error code descriptions: Not provided.

Solutions:

1. Wait a few minutes and try again.
2. Check if there's an alert on the Roku support site for an extended outage. If there's an alert, try again when the outage is over.
3. Check if the Roku device is connected to the correct network.
4. Check if the router is working properly.
5. Check if there's a strong enough wireless signal.
6. Restart the Roku device and your router.
7. Connect via Ethernet for a faster and more reliable connection.

This document provides solutions to troubleshoot a Roku streaming device that is unable to update its software. It suggests waiting a few minutes and trying again, checking for an alert on the Roku support site, checking the connection to the correct network, checking the router, checking the wireless signal, restarting the Roku device and the router, and connecting via Ethernet. This document can answer questions about how to troubleshoot a Roku streaming device that is unable to update its software, what to do if the device is not updating, and how to improve the connection.

Title:How to connect your Roku streaming device to the internet using Wi-Fi or Ethernet

- Error code 14.41

Descriptions:
- Password issues
- Wi-Fi signal strength issues
- Ethernet cable related issues
- Slow internet speed issues
- Connectivity issues
- Unable to connect to wireless network
- Checking wireless connection
- Not connected to the internet
- Loading, please wait.

Solutions:
- Re-enter your password
- Move your Roku device closer to your wireless router
- Unplug your Ethernet cable then plug it back in, or try a different one
- Upgrade your internet to a faster connection
- Restart your router and Roku device
- Follow the on-screen suggestions
- Check Wi-Fi network name and password; ensure router is working properly; improve wireless signal strength; use an Ethernet cable or third-party adapter; restart router or Roku device
- Most channels require a reliable internet connection or you may experience interruptions when streaming
- This screen appears when the network or internet connection is lost during playback.

This document provides instructions on how to connect a Roku streaming device to the internet using Wi-Fi or Ethernet. It also provides solutions to common error codes, such as password issues, Wi-Fi signal strength issues, Ethernet cable related issues, slow internet speed issues, and connectivity issues. This document can answer questions such as how to connect a Roku device to the internet, how to troubleshoot common error codes, and how to improve internet connection speed.

Title:How to check the connection to your home network and the internet

Error codes:
- A red ‘x’ appears for Wireless connection: This indicates that the Roku device cannot make a connection to the router. 
- A red ‘x’ appears for Internet connection: This means the Roku device is able to connect to the wireless network but is unable to connect to the internet.

Solutions:
- For a red ‘x’ on wireless connection, return to the Network menu, select Set up connection, and try connecting the Roku device to the network again. If uncertain about the correct network, get help finding the wireless network name and password. If problems persist, learn what to do if your Roku device cannot access your home network.
- For a red ‘x’ on internet connection, test the connection using a computer or mobile device connected to the home network. If the internet is not accessible, contact the ISP to check for an outage in the area. If the internet is accessible, double-check that the Roku device is connected to the correct wireless network. If the problem persists, restart both the router and the Roku device.

This document provides instructions on how to check the connection to a home network and the internet on a Roku device. It explains the meaning of a red 'x' appearing for either the wireless connection or the internet connection. Solutions are provided for each error code, such as returning to the Network menu, testing the connection with a computer or mobile device, and restarting the router and Roku device. This document can answer questions about how to check the connection to a home network and the internet on a Roku device, what a red 'x' indicates, and how to troubleshoot connection issues.

Title:What to do if your Roku Smart Home device is offline or you see error code 90?

Error code 90: device is offline

Solution: 
1. Check if the device is powered on.
2. Inspect the power connection.
3. Restart the device.
4. Update and restart the app.
5. Check device firmware.
6. Test Wi-Fi connection.
7. Set up your device again.
8. Factory reset your device. 

Note: This article does not provide any other error codes descriptions or solutions.

This document provides a solution to the issue of a Roku Smart Home device being offline or displaying error code 90. The steps outlined include checking if the device is powered on, inspecting the power connection, restarting the device, updating and restarting the app, checking device firmware, testing the Wi-Fi connection, setting up the device again, and factory resetting the device. This document can answer questions about what to do if a Roku Smart Home device is offline or displaying error code 90, as well as provide a step-by-step guide on how to resolve the issue.

Title:How to change Wi-Fi settings on your Roku Smart Home device

Error codes and their descriptions:

- Error code 90: This error code can be seen if the smart home device is offline.

Solutions:

- To update Wi-Fi settings, repeat the setup process and connect smart home devices to the new network.
- To change Wi-Fi settings for the camera or video doorbell, set up each device from the smart home app without resetting the device.
- To update Wi-Fi settings for the smart home bulb, plug, or light strip, factory reset each device and then set it up again using the smart home app.
- If you have trouble connecting your device to your new Wi-Fi network, refer to troubleshooting options, including error code 90.

This document provides instructions on how to change Wi-Fi settings on a Roku Smart Home device. It outlines the steps to take to update Wi-Fi settings for the camera, video doorbell, smart home bulb, plug, or light strip. It also provides troubleshooting options, including error code 90, which can be seen if the smart home device is offline. This document can answer questions about how to change Wi-Fi settings on a Roku Smart Home device, how to update Wi-Fi settings for the camera or video doorbell, and how to update Wi-Fi settings for the smart home bulb, plug, or light strip.
